page.title: 08"KETT DAY" JULY 6TH 1985
page.content: {BY MR.S.Kelly (Organiser) Kett Day was held in Wymondham on July 6th; the anniversary of the local peasant's uprising against the enclosure of common land.Robert Kett, a Wymondham landowner led the uprising in 1549. On the day, the town was closed to traffic and an attempt was made to recreate the atmosphere of a medieval feast day. Many town organisations contributed events such as dancing, singing and street theatre. There were also demonstrations of arts and crafts The day began with a service at the Abbey which was followed by the Kett lecture given by the Arch Deacon of Norfolk from the steps of the Market Cross. All those with the name of Kett were invited to Wymondham to join in the celebrations.
